meanings.definition: The state or quality of being permeable.
meanings.sent1: The permeance of the sponge allowed the water to flow through easily.
meanings.sent2: The permeance of the fabric made it ideal for breathable clothing.
meanings.sent3: The permeance of the sieve was so high that even tiny particles could pass through.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a permeance that touched everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The permeance of the fog obscured the view of the city skyline.

meanings.definition: The ability to allow liquids or gases to pass through.
meanings.sent1: The permeance of the membrane was crucial for the filtration process.
meanings.sent2: The permeance of the material determined its suitability for the task.
meanings.sent3: The permeance of the balloon was tested by filling it with helium.
meanings.sent4: His words had a permeance that spread throughout the room.
meanings.sent5: The permeance of the wind through the trees created a soothing sound.
